newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds end lower in line with U.S. market.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds end lower in line with U.S. market.

text.p: Argentine bonds ended lower in a cautious market due to the decline Monday in U.S. markets, local dealers said.
"The fact that Thursday was an Easter holiday in Argentina while U.S. markets remained open and fell, made the fall even steeper," a dealer said.
Local players remained at the sidelines and volume was thin. A rise in the U.S. long bond yield to 7.10 percent induced a fall in Argentine Brady Bonds.
Argentina's FRB due 2005 closed lower at 89-1/4, after closing at 90-5/8 on Wednesday, the last trading day in Argentina before the Easter holiday.
The dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 ended at $126.60 with no change from the opening but still lower than its previous close of $126.85.
"The only positive feature of the day was that there was no panic," a local dealer said. "The market's attention is fully focused in the U.S. market."
